name: HD 7924
scenarioDescription:
The HD 7924 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 7924 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 55.45 light years away from the solar system.

HD 7924 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 7924 system


HD 7924 b

HD 7924 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 b is 6.36 times the mass of Earth. At 6.36 Earth masses, HD 7924 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 7924 c

HD 7924 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 c is 7.86414 times the mass of Earth. At 7.86414 Earth masses, HD 7924 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 7924 d

HD 7924 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 d is 6.44268 times the mass of Earth. At 6.44268 Earth masses, HD 7924 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 7924, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
